question.questionText: How do you define a controlled experiment?

referenceAnswers.referenceAnswer: An experiment is controlled if only one variable is changed at a time.

studentAnswers.studentAnswer: A controlled experiment is an experiment where you only change one variable.
An experiment where you only change one variable.
A controlled experiment is an experiment where only one variable is changed.
The longer the string the shorter the swings.
A experiment in which one variable is changed.
An experiment that only changes one variable at a time.
A controlled experiment is when you only change one variable at a time instead of 2 or more.
That you only put one penny at a time.
A controlled experiment is a experiment that you can control by weight and the length of string.
A controlled experiment is when you change one variable at a time to affect the outcome.
When you only change one variable at a time.

A controlled experiment is like a release position because a release position is a controlled experiment.
If you do not change one variable at a time its not a controlled experiment.

Where you control the variables, length, mass, release position. But you cannot control the amount of time it swings.
